title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB (Windows Software with Bugs) session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: Upon attempting to shut down Windows with a WSWB session open and a dirty .txt file, a warning or question message box should appear to give users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu, select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer.
5. Expected results: A warning or question message box should appear, giving users the opportunity to save their changes before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
